reviewText:
Good:  + playable even on older systems
+ challenging difficulty caused by the control scheme / color change system
+ fast loading times
+ nice background art / music
+ keyboard and controller support but I prefer keyboard controls

Improvement suggestions:  more puzzle variety, too much lever/button puzzles, the second to last level shows some nice mechanics,
the color system has so much potential
better story-connection between cutscenes and gameplay, cutscenes should contain more artwork
single level select after beating the game
game and comic book could be longer ;-)
I would recommend the game to players who like (difficult) platform games and comic books :)
It's good value!
voteText: 10 of 16 people (63%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Spectrum is game set on the pages of a comic book. This comic book is the most boring comic on the face of the planet. Generic colored floating rock after different colored generic floating rock occupy the pages. You jump from platform to platform while changing color to match what you want to touch. Some platforms have walls that you can walk through when you don’t match the color. Others have walls the same color as the platform
date: forcing you to flip colors twice in one jump. As you progress more colors are added
hoursPlayed: and the story drags on. Occasionally
voteText: there are enemies in your way. You can only avoid these enemies
helpfulPercent: there is no way to kill them. And sometimes you are chased through the level
votesHelpful: forcing you to make changes fast that you normally would. These were the only parts of the game there were exciting. Spectrum has large number of save spots
votesTotal: you can practice small sections of the game until you get the button combinations just right and then move on."\n\nFull review at  http://opnoobs.com/reviews/spectrum.php"
column17: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Smashed keyboard simulator
Unmentioned system requirements:
- A keyboard (or controller) stronger than your fists
- Lots of lube
